Package org.jlab.kafka.eventsource

Interface EventSourceListener<K,V>

Type Parameters:
K - The type for message keys
V - The type for message values
public interface EventSourceListener<K,V>
An EventSourceListener can be registered to receive batch-processing call-backs from an EventSourceTable.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    batch(List<EventSourceRecord<K,V>> records, boolean highWaterReached)
    This callback is invoked periodically depending on EventSourceConfig.EVENT_SOURCE_POLL_MILLIS and will contain no more than EventSourceConfig.EVENT_SOURCE_MAX_POLL_RECORDS.
    default void
    highWaterOffset(LinkedHashMap<K,EventSourceRecord<K,V>> records)
    This callback is invoked only once, upon determination of initial state (high water mark reached).
    default void
    highWaterOffsetTimeout()
    This callback indicates the high water mark was not reached before EVENT_SOURCE_HIGH_WATER_TIMEOUT.

  • Method Details

    • highWaterOffset

      default void highWaterOffset(LinkedHashMap<K,EventSourceRecord<K,V>> records)
      This callback is invoked only once, upon determination of initial state (high water mark reached). Note: The high water mark is queried upon connection to the Kafka server, but if producers submit messages after that connection is established the client's knowledge of the high water mark will be out-of-date. Note: If the configuration *compacted.cache* is false, then the records argument will be empty.
      Parameters:
      records - The compacted list of all records up to the high water mark

    • highWaterOffsetTimeout

      default void highWaterOffsetTimeout()
      This callback indicates the high water mark was not reached before EVENT_SOURCE_HIGH_WATER_TIMEOUT.

    • batch

      default void batch(List<EventSourceRecord<K,V>> records, boolean highWaterReached)
      This callback is invoked periodically depending on EventSourceConfig.EVENT_SOURCE_POLL_MILLIS and will contain no more than EventSourceConfig.EVENT_SOURCE_MAX_POLL_RECORDS. This method is invoked after the highWaterOffset method via the single polling thread such that the highWaterReached callback always runs before the batch method highWaterReached transition. This allows callers to safely ignore batch updates until the highWaterOffset method is called without worrying about a race condition.
      Parameters:
      records - The ordered list of records
      highWaterReached - true if highwater mark reached, false otherwise
